page.title: 08MELSONBY-The Women's Inst'te
page.content: On Tuesday of this week, 24th. Sept. 1985, the local{Women's Institute} is to celebrate its{40th. anniversary with a party to be held in the Methodist School. Some eight of the founder members will attend, one of whom{Mrs I. Elliott,}now lives near {Wolverhampton}and also the{first {president, Mrs Wimbush}who in{1945}was the{wife of the then Rector of St {James's (Canon Wimbush),}now retired to York but who later became{Bishop of {Argylle & the Isles.} There are now only{20 members}c.f. 48 forty years ago(a percentage reduction similar to that of pupils at the school). This Institute forms part of the{North Yorks West Fed'n, Teesdale {group.}Meetings are held monthly in the school when either a talk or craft/ cookery etc. demonstration is given by a guest speaker.
